channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report X-2024030393
item.description:
Report X-2024030393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: VENTED CAP LEAKING DURING TRANSIT, UNLOADED, PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: VENTED CAP LEAKING CORROSIVE LIQUID INSIDE A WET TORN OPENED DTERIATED SOILED BOX SOILING ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024021749
item.description:
Report X-2024021749

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver discovered package because of liquid leaking from bottom of package. Package had weight on top, bottom inner containers were cracked with liquid coming out of them. package was placed in lined tote and brought to QA cage by driver. DescribePack: Bottom inner containers were cracked on bottom with liquid leaking from cracks. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in lined hazmat drum after it was brought to the cage. spillage in truck was cleaned by driver with paper towels before QA was made aware of package. cleaning materials were placed with package in lined hazmat salvage drum. Truck was examined for leaked materials and none were found left behind.

item.title: Report X-2024021913
item.description:
Report X-2024021913

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE AND FOLLOWING DECISION TREE, RESPONDER RESPONDED TO TRAILER, PLACED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION OF CONTENTS RESPONDER DETERMINED THE CONTENTS MAY BE HAZARDOUS. PULLED SDS AND IT INDICATED IT SHOULD BE DECLARED. HMSC CONFIRMED UNDECLARED STATUS. FOLLOWED UNDECLARED PROTOCOL.
